Removing PSReadLine doesn't impact the Tab-Completion in both Windows PowerShell and PowerShell Core.

But tab-completion stops working in non-Windows Systems!

Steps to reproduce
------------------
Remove the PSReadLine module and use the change directory command tab to complete folder name

```powershell
Remove-Module -Name PSReadLine
cd Docu (press-tab)
Get-Mod(tab) -List(tab)
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
To auto-complete the line.
```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------
Doing Tab does nothing!
```none

```

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body:
This is by design and related to how the system level command line editing is implemented.

On Windows systems, there is a (mostly simple) hook to provide a callback when hitting <kbd>Tab</kbd> and PowerShell used that hook from the very beginning.

On non-Windows systems, there is no such hook. If you want custom behavior when typing any key like <kbd>Tab</kbd>, you must fully implement command line editing, which is exactly what PSReadLine does.

It was an intentional decision to **not** implement another command line editor for non-Windows systems. Actually, there was a basic one before PSReadLine was ported, but it never supported tab completion, and when it came time to consider implementing tab completion, porting PSReadLine was the more pragmatic option.

title: Preview.4 - Remove-Module PSReadLine stops Tab Completion in non-Windows systems
